features.name: SQL Injection Protection
features.description: Verifies that all user inputs are properly sanitized and parameterized queries or prepared statements are used to prevent SQL injection attacks.
verification_steps: Test all input fields with SQLi payloads: ' OR '1'='1, " OR "1"="1
Test UNION-based injections: ' UNION SELECT null,username,password FROM users--
Test error-based: ' AND 1=CAST((SELECT table_name FROM information_schema.tables) AS INT)--
Check for database errors in response
features.remediation: Use prepared statements with parameterized queries. Sanitize all inputs with $wpdb->prepare(). Implement input validation. Use WordPress security plugins with SQLi protection.
evidence_requirements: 403 Forbidden responses to SQL injection attempts
Code review confirming prepared statements usage

features.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Protection
features.description: Tests for proper input sanitization and output escaping to prevent reflected, stored, and DOM-based XSS attacks.
verification_steps: Test all input fields with basic XSS payload: <script>alert('XSS')</script>
Test for stored XSS in comments, user profiles, posts
Test reflected XSS in search, contact forms, URL parameters
Test SVG file upload with XSS payload
Test event handlers: onload, onerror, onclick in HTML attributes
Use OWASP ZAP or Burp Suite active scanner
Check if output is properly escaped with esc_html(), esc_attr()
features.remediation: Use esc_html(), esc_attr(), esc_url() for output. Validate and sanitize inputs with sanitize_text_field(). Implement Content Security Policy (CSP).
evidence_requirements: No script execution in test scenarios

features.name: Broken Authentication and Session Management
features.description: Tests authentication mechanisms, session handling, password policies, and multi-factor authentication implementation.
verification_steps: Attempt brute force attacks with rate limiting verification
Check cookie security attributes (Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite)
features.remediation: Implement strong password policies. Use session regeneration. Set secure cookie attributes. Implement rate limiting and account lockout. Consider 2FA implementation.
evidence_requirements: Rate limiting active on login page

features.name: Broken Access Control
features.description: Tests for insecure direct object references, missing function-level access controls, and privilege escalation vulnerabilities.
features.test_method: Manual testing with privilege escalation attempts
verification_steps: Test IDOR by changing numeric IDs in URLs: /user/123 â†’ /user/124
Test parameter tampering in POST/PUT requests
Test admin functionality without admin role: /wp-admin/ access
Test API endpoints without proper authentication
Check if users can edit others' content
Test direct access to uploaded files without permission
features.remediation: Implement proper role-based access control (RBAC). Validate permissions on every request. Use WordPress capabilities system properly. Implement CSRF tokens.
evidence_requirements: Permission checks on all sensitive operations

features.name: Insecure Deserialization Protection
features.description: Tests for insecure deserialization of user-supplied data that could lead to remote code execution or privilege escalation.
verification_steps: Identify serialized data in cookies, parameters, or files
Test with ysoserial or similar exploit generation tools
Look for unserialize() function usage in code
Test file upload with serialized payloads
Check session handling for serialized data
features.remediation: Avoid unserializing user input. Use JSON instead of serialization. Implement digital signatures on serialized data. Use safe deserialization libraries.
evidence_requirements: JSON used instead of PHP serialization

features.name: Sensitive Data Exposure Prevention
features.description: Protects configuration files, database credentials, version information, and other sensitive data from unauthorized access.
verification_steps: Check for exposed backup files: wp-config.php.bak
Verify debug mode is disabled in production
features.remediation: Protect wp-config.php. Remove readme.html. Disable debug mode in production. Set proper file permissions. Hide version information.

features.name: HTTP Security Headers
features.description: Implements modern browser security headers including X-Frame-Options, CSP, HSTS, and others.
features.remediation: Add security headers via .htaccess or nginx. Implement CSP with proper directives. Enable HSTS. Set secure Referrer-Policy.

features.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) Protection
features.description: Tests for presence of anti-CSRF tokens in state-changing requests and proper validation mechanisms.
verification_steps: Check for nonce tokens in forms: _wpnonce or nonce parameters
Test without token: remove nonce and submit form
Test with invalid token: change nonce value
Check if token is tied to user session and action
Test token reuse: use same token twice
Use Burp Suite to test for CSRF vulnerabilities
features.remediation: Use WordPress nonces (wp_nonce_field(), wp_nonce_url()). Implement SameSite cookies. Add CSRF protection to custom forms.

features.name: Insufficient Logging and Monitoring
features.description: Verifies that security events are properly logged, monitored, and alerts are configured for suspicious activities.
verification_steps: Check if failed login attempts are logged
Test if admin actions are recorded
Test if brute force attempts trigger alerts
Check log rotation and retention policies
Verify logs are stored securely (not in web root)
features.remediation: Implement comprehensive logging. Set up log monitoring. Configure alerts for suspicious activities. Regular log review.

features.name: Disable File Editing
features.description: Disables the WordPress theme and plugin file editor from the admin panel to prevent code modification attacks.
features.remediation: Add define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true); to wp-config.php before wp-settings.php require.

features.name: Input Validation
features.description: Validates and sanitizes all user inputs to prevent injection attacks and malformed data processing.
features.test_method: Manual input testing with malformed data
verification_steps: Test with numeric fields using non-numeric input
Test with special characters and unicode
Verify WordPress sanitization functions are used
Check for type validation on all inputs
features.remediation: Use WordPress sanitization functions. Implement type validation. Validate on both client and server side. Use whitelist validation where possible.

features.name: Rate Limiting
features.description: Implements rate limiting on critical endpoints like login, registration, and API to prevent brute force and DoS attacks.
verification_steps: Use Apache Bench for load testing
Monitor for 429 Too Many Requests responses
features.remediation: Implement server-level rate limiting. Use fail2ban. Add rate limiting to WordPress functions. Monitor and adjust limits based on legitimate traffic.

features.name: Disable User Enumeration
features.description: Prevents user enumeration through author archives, login errors, and REST API endpoints.
verification_steps: Check login error messages for username validation
Test registration page for username existence check
features.remediation: Block author archives. Restrict REST API users endpoint. Use generic login error messages. Implement user enumeration protection.

features.name: Content Security Policy (CSP)
features.description: Implements CSP headers to prevent XSS, clickjacking, and other code injection attacks.
verification_steps: Verify CSP directives are properly configured
Test for unsafe-inline and unsafe-eval usage
Use browser console for CSP violations
features.remediation: Implement strict CSP policy. Avoid unsafe directives. Use nonces or hashes for inline scripts. Enable CSP reporting.

features.name: Disable XML-RPC
features.description: Disables or restricts the XML-RPC interface to prevent brute force attacks and DDoS amplification.
features.remediation: Block xmlrpc.php at server level. Use .htaccess or nginx to return 403. Alternatively use WordPress filters to disable specific methods.

features.name: Disable REST API
features.description: Restricts or disables WordPress REST API endpoints to prevent unauthorized data access and user enumeration.
features.remediation: Disable REST API if not needed. Require authentication for all endpoints. Block specific sensitive endpoints like users.
evidence_requirements: No data exposure to unauthenticated users

features.name: Cron Protection
features.description: Secures wp-cron.php to prevent abuse and DoS attacks through repeated cron execution.
verification_steps: Verify DISABLE_WP_CRON if using system cron
features.remediation: Disable WordPress cron and use system cron. Block direct access to wp-cron.php. Implement rate limiting if keeping WordPress cron.
evidence_requirements: WordPress cron disabled (if using system cron)

features.name: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
features.description: Monitors and updates WordPress core, themes, and plugins to prevent exploitation of known vulnerabilities.
verification_steps: Run wp plugin list with versions
Run wp theme list with versions
features.remediation: Regular updates of core, plugins, themes. Remove unused components. Subscribe to security bulletins. Use vulnerability scanners regularly.

features.name: Security Misconfiguration
features.description: Addresses common misconfigurations including default settings, verbose errors, and unnecessary services.
features.remediation: Harden WordPress configuration. Remove unused plugins/themes. Secure file permissions. Implement security headers. Regular security audits.

features.name: Session Management Security
features.description: Ensures secure session handling with proper timeout, regeneration, and cookie attributes.
verification_steps: Check cookie attributes: HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite
Check if session regenerates on login
Use Burp Suite to analyze session cookies
features.remediation: Set Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite cookies. Implement session timeout. Regenerate session IDs on privilege change. Store sessions securely.

features.name: Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR)
features.description: Tests for IDOR vulnerabilities allowing access to unauthorized resources by modifying object references.
features.remediation: Implement access control checks on all object references. Use unpredictable identifiers. Map user sessions to resources.

features.name: WordPress Version Disclosure
features.description: Checks if the WordPress version is publicly visible via generator tags, readme files, or error messages, which can help attackers target known vulnerabilities.
verification_steps: View page source and search for 'generator' meta tag
Access /readme.html and check for version number
Trigger error by accessing non-existent page, check if version appears
Use wpscan or similar tool: `wpscan --url http://example.com --enumerate vp`
Check REST API endpoints: `/wp-json/wp/v2` may return version
features.remediation: Add to wp-config.php: `remove_action('wp_head', 'wp_generator');`. Delete readme.html. Configure server to not reveal version in errors.

features.name: Weak Password Policy Enforcement
features.description: Tests if the application enforces strong password policies including minimum length, complexity requirements, and prevents common passwords.
verification_steps: Attempt to register or change password with weak passwords (123456, password, qwerty)
Test minimum length requirement by trying passwords under 8 characters
Test complexity: try passwords without numbers, special characters, or mixed case
Check if password strength meter enforces requirements
Attempt to reuse old passwords during password change
Use Burp Suite Intruder with common passwords list
features.remediation: Implement strong password policy (min 12 chars, complexity). Use password strength meter. Consider password blacklist. Implement password history (prevent reuse).

features.name: XML External Entity (XXE) Protection
features.description: Checks if XML processors are configured to prevent XXE attacks by disabling external entity processing.
verification_steps: Identify XML input points (file uploads, API endpoints)
Test with malicious XML: `<?xml version="1.0"?><!DOCTYPE root [<!ENTITY test SYSTEM "file:///etc/passwd">]><root>&test;</root>`
Test for out-of-band XXE using external domains
Use XXEinjector tool for comprehensive testing
features.remediation: Disable XML external entity processing. Use JSON instead of XML where possible. Use PHP's `libxml_disable_entity_loader(true)`. Keep XML processors updated.
evidence_requirements: No file system access via XXE

features.name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
features.description: Checks for vulnerabilities that allow attackers to make requests from the server to internal resources or external domains.
verification_steps: Test URL parameters that fetch external resources
Test for blind SSRF using Burp Collaborator
Check XML import functionality for XXE-based SSRF
features.remediation: Validate and sanitize URL inputs. Use allowlists for domains/IPs. Implement network segmentation. Disable unused URL schemes. Use cloud metadata protection.

features.name: File Upload Security
features.description: Tests file upload functionality for proper file type validation, content checking, and secure storage.
verification_steps: Test content-type bypass: change Content-Type header
Upload malicious files with valid image headers (Polyglot files)
Check if files are stored outside web root
features.remediation: Validate file type by content, not extension. Use allowlists for file types. Store files outside web root. Use secure file permissions. Scan uploaded files.

features.name: Directory Traversal
features.description: Tests for vulnerabilities that allow reading or writing files outside the web root directory.
verification_steps: Test path traversal with encoded characters: `..%2f..%2f`
Test in log file viewing features
Use dot-dot-slash payloads with various encodings
features.remediation: Validate file paths. Use basename() to extract filename. Implement path canonicalization. Use allowlists for accessible files. Web server hardening.
evidence_requirements: File access restricted to intended directories
No file system access via traversal

features.name: Admin Interface Protection
features.description: Verifies that WordPress admin interface is properly protected with strong authentication, IP restrictions, and rate limiting.
verification_steps: Test brute force on login page
Check if admin area uses HTTPS
Test session timeout in admin area
Verify admin email is not publicly accessible
features.remediation: Implement strong passwords + 2FA. Rename admin path or IP restrict. Use HTTPS. Implement login attempt limiting. Regular admin session timeout.

features.name: XML-RPC API Security
features.description: Tests the XML-RPC interface for vulnerabilities including pingback DDoS amplification, brute force attacks, and remote code execution.
verification_steps: Check if XML-RPC is enabled: `curl -X POST -d '<methodCall><methodName>system.listMethods</methodName></methodCall>' http://site.com/xmlrpc.php`
Test for XXE in XML-RPC requests
features.remediation: Disable XML-RPC if not needed: add to .htaccess `RewriteRule ^xmlrpc\.php$ - [F,L]`. Use security plugins to block abuse. Implement rate limiting.
evidence_requirements: Brute force attempts via XML-RPC blocked

features.name: REST API Endpoint Security
features.description: Tests WordPress REST API endpoints for proper authentication, authorization, and input validation.
verification_steps: Test unauthenticated access to protected endpoints
Test injection vulnerabilities in API parameters
Test rate limiting on API endpoints
features.remediation: Disable REST API if not used. Require authentication for sensitive endpoints. Implement proper permissions. Add rate limiting. Use API security plugins.

features.name: Brute Force Protection
features.description: Verifies implementation of account lockout, CAPTCHA, and rate limiting mechanisms for login attempts.
verification_steps: Test multiple failed login attempts on same account
Test distributed attacks from different IPs
Check if lockout duration is reasonable
Use Hydra or similar tools (with permission)
features.remediation: Implement account lockout after X attempts. Use CAPTCHA. Add rate limiting per IP. Use 2FA. Monitor failed login attempts. Use WordPress security plugins.
evidence_requirements: Account lockout active after failed attempts
Failed login attempts logged and monitored

features.name: SSL/TLS Configuration
features.description: Tests for proper SSL/TLS configuration including protocol versions, cipher suites, and certificate validity.
verification_steps: Test for SSLv2, SSLv3, TLS 1.0, TLS 1.1 support
Check cipher strength and weak ciphers
features.remediation: Disable old protocols (SSLv2, SSLv3, TLS 1.0). Use strong cipher suites. Implement HSTS. Renew certificates before expiration. Use Qualys SSL Test regularly.
evidence_requirements: SSL Labs grade A or higher

features.name: Database Security Configuration
features.description: Verifies secure database configuration including proper permissions, encryption, and connection security.
verification_steps: Check database user permissions (SELECT only needed)
Verify database connection uses SSL if remote
Check if database credentials are in wp-config.php
Verify table prefix is not default 'wp_'
Check database version for known vulnerabilities
features.remediation: Use least privilege database users. Encrypt database connections. Secure wp-config.php. Change default table prefix. Regular database updates and patches.

features.name: File Permissions
features.description: Checks for proper file and directory permissions on WordPress files, preventing unauthorized read/write access.
verification_steps: Test for writable PHP files in web root
features.remediation: Set proper permissions: directories 755, files 644, wp-config.php 640. Use correct ownership. Regular permission audits. Use security plugins to check.
evidence_requirements: No world-writable files in web root

features.name: wp-config.php Protection
features.description: Verifies that wp-config.php file is properly protected and contains secure configuration settings.
verification_steps: Verify WP_DEBUG is false in production
Check for database table prefix customization
Test for backup files: wp-config.php.bak, wp-config.php.save
features.remediation: Move wp-config.php one level above web root if possible. Set proper file permissions. Use unique security keys. Disable file editor. Remove backup files.
evidence_requirements: Security keys are defined and unique

features.name: .htaccess Security Rules
features.description: Tests for presence of security hardening rules in .htaccess or web server configuration.
verification_steps: Check if .htaccess exists in WordPress root
Verify XML-RPC blocking if not used
Test for PHP execution in uploads directory
Check for user agent blocking if applicable
features.remediation: Implement security hardening in .htaccess. Block directory listing. Restrict file access. Disable XML-RPC if unused. Add security headers. Regular .htaccess review.

features.name: Debug Mode Exposure
features.description: Checks if WordPress debug mode is enabled in production, potentially exposing sensitive information.
verification_steps: Trigger PHP errors and check for detailed messages
Look for `define('WP_DEBUG_LOG', true);` and log location
Test with invalid query parameter to trigger errors
Check if debug information appears in page source
Use WordPress CLI: `wp config get WP_DEBUG`
features.remediation: Set `WP_DEBUG` to false in production. Use `WP_DEBUG_LOG` for debugging but not `WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY`. Remove debug information from production. Regular config review.
evidence_requirements: WP_DEBUG set to false in production
No sensitive data in error messages

features.name: Database Error Disclosure
features.description: Tests for database error messages exposed to users, which could reveal sensitive information.
verification_steps: Trigger SQL errors with invalid queries
Check for detailed error messages in response
Check if errors are logged instead of displayed
Check AJAX endpoints for error disclosure
Monitor network traffic for error details
features.remediation: Set `display_errors` to Off in php.ini. Configure WordPress to log errors instead of displaying. Use custom error pages. Implement proper error handling.
evidence_requirements: Database errors not displayed to users
No sensitive information in error messages

features.name: PHP Error Reporting
features.description: Verifies that PHP error reporting is disabled in production environment.
verification_steps: Create a PHP file with `<?php echo ini_get('display_errors'); ?>`
Test with syntax error in PHP files
Test with division by zero or undefined variables
features.remediation: Set `display_errors = Off` in php.ini. Set `error_reporting` to appropriate level. Use `ini_set()` in code if needed. Regular PHP configuration review.

features.name: Directory Listing
features.description: Tests for enabled directory listing which could expose sensitive files and directory structure.
verification_steps: Verify server responds with directory listing
Use DirBuster or similar directory brute-forcing tools
features.remediation: Add `Options -Indexes` to .htaccess. Ensure each directory has index.php or index.html. Configure web server to disable directory listing. Regular directory checks.

features.name: Backup File Exposure
features.description: Scans for exposed backup files (.bak, .backup, .sql, etc.) containing sensitive data.
verification_steps: Use tools like DirBuster with backup file wordlists
features.remediation: Remove backup files from web root. Store backups in secure locations. Use .htaccess to block backup file access. Implement proper backup procedures outside web root.
evidence_requirements: No backup files in web root

features.name: Configuration File Exposure
features.description: Tests for exposed configuration files (config.php, configuration.php, etc.) with database credentials.
verification_steps: Look for `robots.txt` that may reveal sensitive paths
Use automated scanners for configuration files
features.remediation: Move sensitive config files outside web root. Set proper file permissions (600). Use environment variables for credentials. Regular security scans for exposed files.
evidence_requirements: Credentials not exposed in web root

features.name: Log File Exposure
features.description: Checks for exposed log files containing sensitive information about users and system activities.
verification_steps: Check for common log file locations
Use directory traversal to access log files
features.remediation: Disable public access to log files via .htaccess. Store logs outside web root. Regularly rotate and delete old logs. Use secure logging plugins.
evidence_requirements: Log files not accessible via web

features.name: Source Code Disclosure
features.description: Tests for source code disclosure vulnerabilities through misconfigured servers or file handling.
verification_steps: Test for PHP source disclosure via path manipulation
Test file inclusion with PHP filters
Look for `.svn` or other version control files
Test for LFI vulnerabilities that reveal source code
Check for misconfigured servers exposing source
features.remediation: Configure web server to parse PHP files properly. Remove version control directories. Secure file inclusion. Regular source code disclosure checks.

features.name: Clickjacking Protection
features.description: Verifies implementation of X-Frame-Options or Content-Security-Policy frame-ancestors directives.
verification_steps: Verify X-Frame-Options is set to DENY or SAMEORIGIN
Verify admin pages cannot be framed
Use browser developer tools to test framing
features.remediation: Implement X-Frame-Options: DENY. Use CSP frame-ancestors directive. Add frame-busting JavaScript for older browsers. Test clickjacking protection regularly.

features.name: MIME Type Sniffing Protection
features.description: Tests for X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header to prevent MIME type sniffing attacks.
verification_steps: Test with different file types and Content-Type headers
Check if browsers respect the header
Test upload functionality with mismatched MIME types
Verify all resources serve with correct Content-Type
features.remediation: Add X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header. Ensure correct Content-Type for all resources. Test MIME type handling. Regular header verification.

features.name: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)
features.description: Tests for misconfigured CORS policies that could expose sensitive data to unauthorized domains.
verification_steps: Test if wildcard (*) is used improperly
Test different HTTP methods with CORS
Use browser developer tools for CORS testing
features.remediation: Implement strict CORS policies. Avoid wildcard origins. Validate origin headers. Handle preflight requests properly. Test CORS configuration.
evidence_requirements: No wildcard origins for sensitive data

features.name: Subresource Integrity (SRI)
features.description: Checks for Subresource Integrity implementation on externally loaded scripts and stylesheets.
verification_steps: Check script and link tags for integrity attribute
Verify external resources have SRI hashes
Test if SRI prevents tampered resource loading
Check for crossorigin attribute with SRI
Use browser developer tools to verify SRI
Check CDN resources for SRI support
features.remediation: Implement SRI for all external scripts/styles. Generate integrity hashes. Use crossorigin attribute. Regularly update SRI hashes when resources change.

features.name: Insecure HTTP Methods
features.description: Tests for enabled dangerous HTTP methods like PUT, DELETE, TRACE, which could be abused.
verification_steps: Use OPTIONS method to discover allowed methods
Test PUT method for file upload vulnerabilities
Test DELETE method for file removal
Test TRACE method for XST attacks
Check for WebDAV methods if enabled
Test each method with authentication bypass attempts
features.remediation: Disable unnecessary HTTP methods. Allow only GET, POST, HEAD. Use .htaccess to restrict methods. Implement proper authentication for all methods.

features.name: Host Header Injection
features.description: Tests for host header injection vulnerabilities leading to password reset poisoning or cache poisoning.
verification_steps: Check for host override in URLs
Verify email links use correct host
Test cache poisoning via host headers
features.remediation: Validate Host header against allowlist. Use SERVER_NAME instead of Host where possible. Implement proper canonical URLs. Secure password reset functionality.
evidence_requirements: Password reset links use correct domain
No cache poisoning via host headers

features.name: Open Redirect
features.description: Tests for open redirect vulnerabilities that could be used in phishing attacks.
verification_steps: Test URL parameters for redirects (redirect, return, url)
Test with external domains in redirect parameters
Use automated scanners for open redirects
features.remediation: Validate redirect URLs. Use allowlist for redirect domains. Implement redirect confirmation pages. Use relative URLs where possible.

features.name: Local File Inclusion (LFI)
features.description: Tests for local file inclusion vulnerabilities through improper file path handling.
verification_steps: Test file parameters with directory traversal
features.remediation: Validate file paths strictly. Use allowlists for includable files. Disable dangerous PHP wrappers. Implement proper file permission controls.

features.name: Remote File Inclusion (RFI)
features.description: Tests for remote file inclusion vulnerabilities allowing inclusion of external malicious files.
verification_steps: Test file parameters with external URLs
Try including files from attacker-controlled servers
Test with different protocols (http, ftp, php://)
Test for RFI to RCE conversion
features.remediation: Disable allow_url_fopen and allow_url_include. Validate file paths. Use allowlists. Implement WAF rules for RFI. Regular code review for inclusion functions.

features.name: Command Injection
features.description: Tests for command injection vulnerabilities through system command execution with user input.
verification_steps: Test input fields with command separators: `;`, `|`, `&`
Test with blind command injection payloads
features.remediation: Avoid shell command execution with user input. Use built-in PHP functions instead of shell commands. If needed, use `escapeshellarg()`. Implement input validation.
evidence_requirements: No shell command execution with user input

features.name: Template Injection
features.description: Tests for server-side template injection vulnerabilities in templating engines.
verification_steps: Identify template engines used (Twig, Smarty, Blade)
Test template parameters with injection payloads
Check for remote code execution via templates
Check for information disclosure via templates
features.remediation: Sanitize template inputs. Use sandboxed template environments. Keep template engines updated. Implement proper template context separation.

features.name: Email Header Injection
features.description: Tests for email header injection vulnerabilities in contact forms and email functionality.
verification_steps: Test contact form fields with newlines and headers
Test subject and body fields for injection
features.remediation: Validate email inputs. Remove newlines from headers. Use secure email libraries. Implement rate limiting on email functions. Regular email security testing.

features.name: Password Reset Vulnerability
features.description: Tests for password reset functionality vulnerabilities including token leakage, weak tokens, and lack of rate limiting.
verification_steps: Verify rate limiting on reset requests
Test for token leakage in logs or referrers
Check if old tokens are invalidated
Test account enumeration via reset function
features.remediation: Use cryptographically secure tokens. Implement short expiration times. Add rate limiting. Invalidate old tokens. Secure token transmission.

features.name: Account Takeover via Email Change
features.description: Tests for insecure email change functionality that could lead to account takeover.
verification_steps: Check for weak email change tokens
Test if password required for email change
Test for race conditions in email change
Check if old email can still be used
Test account recovery after email change
features.remediation: Require password for email changes. Send confirmation to old email. Use secure tokens. Implement delay before email change takes effect.
evidence_requirements: Confirmation sent to old email address

features.name: Session Fixation
features.description: Tests for session fixation vulnerabilities where attackers can force users to use a known session ID.
verification_steps: Test if session ID changes after login
Check if session ID can be set via URL parameter
Test cookie injection for session fixation
Verify session regeneration on privilege change
Test with different session initialization methods
Test session binding to IP/user agent
features.remediation: Regenerate session ID on login. Don't accept session IDs from URLs. Bind sessions to IP/user agent. Implement proper session management.

features.name: Session Timeout
features.description: Tests for proper session timeout implementation to prevent session hijacking.
verification_steps: Check if sessions expire on browser close
Test session persistence after password change
Check for session invalidation on logout
features.remediation: Implement both idle and absolute timeouts. Destroy sessions properly on logout. Invalidate sessions after password change. Secure remember me functionality.

features.name: Concurrent Session Control
features.description: Tests for controls preventing multiple concurrent sessions for the same user.
verification_steps: Test logging in from multiple devices/browsers
Check if old sessions are invalidated
features.remediation: Implement concurrent session limits. Invalidate old sessions on new login. Track active sessions. Provide admin controls for session management.
evidence_requirements: Old sessions invalidated on new login

features.name: Sensitive Data in URL
features.description: Tests for sensitive data exposure through URL parameters (session tokens, passwords, etc.).
verification_steps: Check for session IDs in URLs
Look for password reset tokens in URLs
Test for API keys in query parameters
Check referrer headers for sensitive data
Verify server logs don't contain sensitive URLs
Use automated scanners for URL parameter analysis
features.remediation: Use POST instead of GET for sensitive data. Avoid tokens in URLs. Implement proper session management. Clean URLs of sensitive data. Use HTTP referrer policy.

features.name: Sensitive Data in Logs
features.description: Tests for sensitive information like passwords or credit card numbers being logged in cleartext.
verification_steps: Check application logs for sensitive data
Test with credit card numbers, passwords in forms
features.remediation: Implement data masking in logs. Don't log sensitive data. Secure log file storage and permissions. Regular log auditing. Use log encryption.

features.name: Data Encryption at Rest
features.description: Tests for encryption of sensitive data stored in databases or file systems.
verification_steps: Check database for encrypted sensitive fields
Verify file system encryption for sensitive files
Test for plaintext data in backups
Check WordPress database for unencrypted sensitive data
features.remediation: Encrypt sensitive database fields. Use file system encryption for sensitive files. Implement proper key management. Use strong encryption algorithms. Regular encryption audits.

features.name: Data Encryption in Transit
features.description: Tests for proper TLS/SSL implementation for data transmission.
verification_steps: Verify TLS version and cipher suites
features.remediation: Enforce HTTPS everywhere. Implement HSTS. Use strong TLS configurations. Regular SSL certificate renewal. Monitor for mixed content.

features.name: Weak Cryptographic Algorithms
features.description: Tests for use of weak or deprecated cryptographic algorithms and protocols.
verification_steps: Check for MD5, SHA1 hash usage
Test for weak password hashing algorithms
features.remediation: Use strong hashing algorithms (bcrypt, Argon2). Deprecate weak algorithms. Use modern TLS configurations. Avoid custom crypto implementations.

features.name: Insecure Random Number Generation
features.description: Tests for insecure random number generation for tokens, passwords, or cryptographic operations.
verification_steps: Check for use of `rand()` instead of cryptographically secure functions
features.remediation: Use cryptographically secure random functions (`random_bytes()`, `openssl_random_pseudo_bytes()`). Ensure sufficient entropy. Test randomness of generated values.

features.name: Business Logic Vulnerabilities
features.description: Tests for business logic flaws including price manipulation, quantity manipulation, and workflow bypass.
verification_steps: Test for price manipulation in e-commerce
Verify access controls in multi-step processes
Test for time-of-check to time-of-use (TOCTOU) issues
features.remediation: Implement server-side validation of business rules. Use atomic transactions. Validate all client-submitted data. Implement proper workflow controls. Regular business logic testing.

features.name: Race Conditions
features.description: Tests for race condition vulnerabilities in concurrent operations like balance transfers or inventory management.
verification_steps: Check inventory management under concurrent access
Test vote/like systems for race conditions
Verify account creation with same details
Use automated race condition testing tools
features.remediation: Use database transactions with proper isolation levels. Implement optimistic/pessimistic locking. Use atomic operations. Test under high concurrency.

features.name: API Rate Limiting
features.description: Tests for proper rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent abuse and DoS attacks.
verification_steps: Test API endpoints without rate limits
Verify different rate limits for authenticated vs anonymous users
Check for burst limits and sustained limits
features.remediation: Implement comprehensive rate limiting. Use different tiers for different user types. Include burst protection. Return proper rate limit headers. Monitor for abuse.
evidence_requirements: Rate limiting active on API endpoints

features.name: Denial of Service (DoS) Protection
features.description: Tests for DoS protection mechanisms including request limiting, resource limits, and timeout handling.
verification_steps: Test for memory exhaustion via large inputs
Verify DoS protection at network/application level
features.remediation: Implement resource limits. Use timeouts on operations. Configure web server for DoS protection. Use CDN/WAF for DDoS protection. Monitor resource usage.

features.name: Web Application Firewall (WAF) Bypass
features.description: Tests for techniques to bypass WAF protections including encoding, fragmentation, and HTTP parameter pollution.
verification_steps: Test SQLi payloads with various encodings
Test with mixed case and encoding
features.remediation: Keep WAF rules updated. Implement multi-layer security. Monitor WAF logs for bypass attempts. Regular WAF testing and tuning. Use behavioral analysis.

features.name: Input Validation Bypass
features.description: Tests for techniques to bypass input validation including null bytes, unicode, and case manipulation.
verification_steps: Test with extra whitespace and newlines
Verify validation on client vs server
Use fuzzing for input validation testing
features.remediation: Implement consistent server-side validation. Normalize inputs before validation. Use allowlists over blocklists. Test validation with various encodings.

features.name: Authentication Bypass
features.description: Tests for authentication bypass techniques including SQL injection in login, default credentials, and backdoors.
verification_steps: Test for SQL injection in login forms
Test cookie manipulation for auth bypass
features.remediation: Implement secure authentication mechanisms. Remove default accounts/credentials. Regular credential audits. Monitor for authentication anomalies. Code review for backdoors.

features.name: Admin Functionality Exposure
features.description: Tests for exposure of admin functionality to unauthenticated or unauthorized users.
verification_steps: Test direct access to admin URLs
Check for admin functionality in front-end
Test API endpoints with admin functions
features.remediation: Implement strict access controls for admin functions. Use role-based permissions. Regularly audit admin access. Monitor for unauthorized admin access attempts.

features.name: Privilege Escalation
features.description: Tests for vertical and horizontal privilege escalation vulnerabilities.
verification_steps: Check for parameter tampering in role assignments
Test horizontal privilege escalation (access other users' data)
Test API endpoints for privilege issues
features.remediation: Implement proper authorization checks. Use principle of least privilege. Validate user permissions on every request. Regular permission audits.

features.name: Mass Assignment
features.description: Tests for mass assignment vulnerabilities allowing users to modify object properties they shouldn't access.
verification_steps: Test form submissions with extra parameters
Check API endpoints for mass assignment
Test with JSON/XML input containing extra fields
features.remediation: Use allowlists for assignable fields. Implement proper data binding. Validate all input fields. Use framework security features for mass assignment protection.

features.name: Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR)
features.description: Tests for IDOR vulnerabilities allowing access to unauthorized resources by modifying object references.
verification_steps: Test numeric IDs in URLs (user/123 â†’ user/124)
Test with different parameter names (id, uid, user_id)
features.remediation: Implement access control checks on all object references. Use unpredictable identifiers. Map user sessions to resources. Regular IDOR testing.

features.name: File Path Traversal
features.description: Tests for file path traversal vulnerabilities in file download or view functionality.
verification_steps: Test with different OS path separators
features.remediation: Validate and sanitize file paths. Use basename() to extract filenames. Implement allowlists for accessible files. Use chroot or similar restrictions.
evidence_requirements: File access restricted to intended directories
No file system access via traversal

features.name: Unrestricted File Upload
features.description: Tests for unrestricted file upload allowing malicious file execution on the server.
verification_steps: Upload PHP files with various extensions
Upload files with malicious content in metadata
Test file size and type restrictions
Check for file execution in upload directory
features.remediation: Validate file type by content, not extension. Use allowlists for file types. Store files outside web root. Scan uploaded files for malware. Set proper permissions.

features.name: Server-Side Validation Bypass
features.description: Tests for bypassing server-side validation through client-side manipulation or parameter tampering.
verification_steps: Check for validation in different application layers
Test with malformed data after validation
Check for race conditions in validation
features.remediation: Implement consistent server-side validation. Don't rely on client-side validation. Validate at multiple layers. Use framework validation features. Regular validation implementation review.

features.name: Client-Side Validation Only
features.description: Tests for reliance on client-side validation without server-side validation.
verification_steps: Disable JavaScript to bypass client validation
Use proxy tools to tamper with requests
Verify all inputs are validated server-side
Test with automated form submission tools
features.remediation: Always implement server-side validation. Use client-side validation for UX only. Validate all inputs on server. Regular validation implementation review.

features.name: Insecure Third-Party Integrations
features.description: Tests for security vulnerabilities in third-party integrations including payment gateways, social login, and APIs.
verification_steps: Verify API key security for third-party services
Test for insecure direct object references in integrations
Check for data leakage to third parties
features.remediation: Vet third-party integrations for security. Implement proper callback validation. Secure API keys and credentials. Monitor third-party service security. Regular integration audits.

features.name: Exposed Adminer/phpMyAdmin
features.description: Tests for exposed database management interfaces accessible from the internet.
verification_steps: Verify access controls on admin interfaces
Test for SQL injection in admin interfaces
Use automated scanners for exposed admin panels
features.remediation: Remove database admin interfaces from production. If needed, restrict by IP. Use strong authentication. Keep admin tools updated. Monitor access attempts.

features.name: WordPress File Editor Access
features.description: Tests for enabled file editor in WordPress admin allowing direct theme/plugin file modification.
verification_steps: Test access to theme/plugin editor in admin
Check for editor capabilities in user roles
Verify audit logging for file edits
Check for file editor plugin vulnerabilities
features.remediation: Add `define('DISALLOW_FILE_EDIT', true);` to wp-config.php. Restrict editor access to specific users. Implement file change monitoring. Regular file integrity checks.
evidence_requirements: File editor disabled for regular users

features.name: Plugin/Theme Editor Vulnerability
features.description: Tests for vulnerabilities in plugin or theme file editors allowing arbitrary code execution.
verification_steps: Test plugin editor for file write vulnerabilities
Check theme editor for code injection
Verify file permission checks in editors
Test for path traversal in editor file selection
Check for CSRF in editor save functions
Verify input validation in editor content
features.remediation: Disable file editors in production. Implement strict file permission checks. Validate all file paths and content. Use code review for custom editors. Monitor file changes.

features.name: wp-cron.php Security
features.description: Tests wp-cron.php for vulnerabilities including DoS and unauthorized task execution.
verification_steps: Check for unauthorized cron task execution
Verify server cron vs WordPress cron
Test for information disclosure via cron
features.remediation: Disable WordPress cron if using server cron. Implement cron authentication if needed. Monitor cron execution. Limit cron resource usage. Regular cron job review.
